Danny Ings will be with the U23's at Huddersfield today having cut short a week off by 4 days to get minutes under his belt. (Paul Joyce)

Last Friday, he asked to play away to Charlton Athletic. Watched by his agent and girlfriend, he arrived home at 2.30am. (Paul Joyce)

Ings: "Matt Konopinski, the club physiotherapist, set me a target when I was non-weight bearing of swimming the equivalent of the channel."

Ings: "Twenty one miles in the swimming pool - which I did. It was just a little target & it felt good when I completed that."

Ings: "Today I couldn’t be happier with where I am fitness wise & how good my knee does feel. I'm in a good place, I want to build on that."

Ings: "I still feel like I have a big part to play in this football club."

Critchley: "A couple of weeks ago we had an in-house game at Melwood & the manager spoke to me & said Marko [Grujic] has made big strides."

Critchley: "But maybe nobody has seen that [improvement] because it’s not visible, so he wanted him to play for the U23s."

Critchley: "I have to say, the games that Marko [Grujic] has played for us, he has done very well in. You can see he is a top-class player."

Critchley: "Sometimes it might not be as visible to supporters but I’m sure Marko in the future will be a really good player for this club."

Liverpool’s American owners have slapped a stunning £1billion price tag on the club after preliminary buy-out talks.

Sunday Mirror Sport can reveal that leading financier Amanda Staveley, who has strong links to billionaires in the Middle East, made initial soundings about the club’s availability on Sunday.


Staveley, who runs PCP Capital Partners, a fund with global assets of more than £28billion.
